summary: This is the Metropolitan Correctional Center's Daily Lieutenant's Log for August 10, 2019, detailing routine operations and the medical emergency for inmate Jeffrey Epstein, who was found unresponsive in his cell and transported to a hospital. The log also includes entries from the preceding shift on August 9, 2019.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: Inmate #76318-054 who was found unresponsive in his cell (Z06-220) on the morning of August 10, 2019, leading to a medical emergency, CPR, and transport to a local hospital.

events.title: Epstein Found Unresponsive
events.description: At approximately 6:33 AM, a medical emergency was announced for inmate Epstein (#76318-054) who was found unresponsive in cell Z06-220. CPR was initiated, 911 was called, and he was transported via ambulance to a local hospital with CPR continuing.

events.title: Epstein Placed in Special Housing
events.description: At 3:58 PM, an inmate (presumably Epstein based on context of psych observation and dry cell references) was transferred to special housing (dry cell).

events.title: Epstein Transferred to Psych Observation
events.description: At 7:24 PM, an inmate was transferred to special housing (psych observation), which aligns with the log's note of an inmate on suicide watch with a companion.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: Inmate Jeffrey Epstein (Reg #76318-054) was found unresponsive in his cell (Z06-220) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center at approximately 6:33 AM on August 10, 2019.
CPR was performed on Epstein by correctional staff and continued by EMTs. He was transported via ambulance to a local hospital at 7:10 AM.
The log indicates Epstein was on 'psych observation' with an inmate companion and was also placed in a 'dry cell' under staff watch in the days/hours leading up to the incident.
The document is an official Bureau of Prisons operations log, recording routine counts, equipment checks, and the specific timeline of the medical emergency response.
The log entries show a change in Epstein's status from being in a general population unit to special housing (psych observation) on the evening of August 10, after the morning medical emergency.
